description: A woman with unblinking eyes. Frightening, yet her voice is calm and precise.

npcTexts: Hello.
Don’t mind my eyes. They’ve been this way since I was young.
I still see things clearly, maybe clearer than most.

options.playerText: How long have you lived here?
npcTexts: I moved in about two months ago.
It’s noisy at night, but I’ve gotten used to it.
For me, a book and silence are enough.
I teach literature.
I believe words are more powerful than weapons.
Wherever I go, I carry books like companions.
I’ve seen new faces, but none truly worrying.
Humans often doubt one another.
Fear usually comes from our own imagination.
Goodbye.
Remember: What we fear most is often just the shadow of ourselves.
Hello.
I spent the evening preparing lessons… or was it reading?
I often confuse work with pleasure.

options.playerText: How long have you stayed here?
npcTexts: Hmm… about six weeks, maybe more.
When teaching, I often lose track of time, as if days blend into one stream.
Do you ever feel that way?
Safe, relatively.
People are the most unpredictable.
I used to see lies in my students’ eyes.
I heard long footsteps in the hall.
But my eyes saw no one.
I assume it was only an illusion of sound.
Goodbye.
Have a good shift.
You look more tired than yesterday. I, however, feel much stronger.
Perhaps it’s proper meals… or learning to draw energy from the air itself.
Of course.
I like hearing students tremble while reading poetry.
It excites me in a strange way.
I keep my distance.
Waiting for others to reveal flaws—that’s when you learn the most about them.
They call it illness, I call it adaptation.
The body always changes with the environment.
Maybe we’re evolving to become more complete.
Sleep well.
And remember… don’t let others hear your heartbeat too clearly.
Some creatures are drawn to that sound.
Oh… don’t look at me as if I’m a monster.
This is simply the final stage of evolution.
I see everything more clearly than ever.
I’ve never felt stronger.
I no longer crave bread or meat.

options.playerText: Do you recall what you said?
npcTexts: Of course.
I told you of books, teaching, human nature.
I remember it all… because it flows in my blood now.
I think humans and impersonators could coexist.
Some are good, some are bad.
Same with them.
Go.
But remember, if your heart races… I will hear it.
